Articles.Content:
So in Ksp, I am making this awesome mothership thing. But what keeps happening is this: When I try to put the decouplers on the wings, One decoupler goes up and one goes down, I have tried pressing C and R and restarting ksp. When I press R it does nothing when it is on the wing. When it is on the fuselage it changes to mirror but when I move it it reverts to radial. Yes it is in SPH. PLEASE help.

Edited June 30, 2016 by IntZEquals0

Moving to Gameplay Questions.

Here's what you're running into:  When you attach a part to another part... and the "parent" part you're attaching it to already has a certain symmetry mode... then the new part will get the same symmetry mode as the parent, regardless of what you try to set the symmetry to.

You're getting the radial symmetry because the wings that you attached were done so with radial.  Therefore, anything you attach to the wings will also get radial.

What you need to do is:  detach the wing, set the symmetry to mirror instead of radial, and re-attach the wing.  It will look the same, but the wing now has mirror symmetry, and therefore anything you attach to it will have mirror symmetry, too.
